t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 2 days ago - In 2004, Toys "R" Us sued Amazon, ... third-party sellers to offer items on the service in categories that Toys "R" Us had been granted exclusivity. In 2006, a court ruled in favor of Toys "R" Us, giving it the right to unwind its agreement with Amazon and establish its independent e-commerce website. The company was later awarded $51 million in damages. In 2001, Amazon entered into a similar agreement with Borders, under which Amazon would comanage Borders.com as a co-branded ...

t: New ways for shoppers to follow brands on Amazon | Amazon Ads
s: October 26, 2021 - We’ve expanded Brand Follow to make it easier for shoppers to follow their favorite brands in Amazon’s store. To follow a brand, shoppers can simply hit the ‘Follow’ button, which has been included as an every-day part of the shopping experience –across Stores, Posts, and Amazon Live.
